skill.name: project-interview
skill.description: Resources for conversational interviews to create learner profiles. Used by project-interviewer agent during /init.
skill.summary: Resources for conversational interviews to create learner profiles. Used by project-interviewer agen...
skill.author: BitYoungjae

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill containing conversation templates and interview examples. All 27 static findings are false positives: the scanner misidentified Korean text patterns as cryptographic algorithms, markdown code block syntax (backticks) as shell execution, and interview methodology terminology as system reconnaissance. The skill only uses Read, Write, and AskUserQuestion tools for managing learner interview data - no network access, command execution, or sensitive system operations.

content.user_title: Create learner profiles through guided interviews
content.value_statement: Conduct natural, conversational interviews to understand learner needs, background, and goals. Generate accurate learner personas that improve content relevance and personalization.
actual_capabilities: Guide conversational interviews to discover learner goals and motivation
Extract learner background knowledge and experience level
Identify preferred learning style and document volume
Generate structured persona.md files from interview data
Adapt interview approach based on domain and input richness
Handle multiple languages and ambiguous topics gracefully
limitations: Limited to conversational interview workflow, not standalone task execution
Depends on other skills (project-scaffolder) for final persona template
No automatic research or content generation capability
Output requires integration with writer agent for actual document creation

use_cases.title: Generate learner personas
use_cases.description: Create detailed learner profiles before producing educational content.

use_cases.title: Understand student needs
use_cases.description: Conduct intake interviews to tailor teaching materials.

use_cases.title: Calibrate documentation level
use_cases.description: Determine reader expertise before writing technical docs.

prompt_templates.title: Start interview
prompt_templates.prompt: Use project-interview skill to conduct an interview. Ask about what they want to learn, their background, and their goals.

prompt_templates.title: Handle vague input
prompt_templates.prompt: Use project-interview skill. Explore interests through open questions. Guide learner toward a specific topic.

prompt_templates.title: Extract technical level
prompt_templates.prompt: Use project-interview skill. Ask about prior experience, specific knowledge gaps, and practical use cases.

prompt_templates.title: Confirm profile
prompt_templates.prompt: Use project-interview skill. Summarize findings conversationally. Ask learner to confirm or correct the profile summary.

output_examples.input: I want to learn Python for data analysis. I work in marketing and want to analyze customer data myself.
output: Goal: Python for data analysis (marketing focus)
Background: Excel formulas, basic SQL, no programming experience
Use case: Customer segmentation, campaign analysis
Recommended: Python basics + pandas + visualization, 100 pages with marketing examples

best_practices: Start with open questions and let learners provide context naturally
Read between the lines to discover implicit needs and motivations
Summarize conversationally rather than reciting form fields
anti_patterns: Rigid question order regardless of learner responses
Ignoring emotional signals like fear or hesitation
Mechanical profile recitation without conversational flow

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: Read, Write, AskUserQuestion. Creates persona.md and interview-data.md files for documentation.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without other dokhak skills?
faq.answer: Yes, but it works best with project-scaffolder for persona templates and writer agent for content generation.

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: Designed for multilingual use. Examples show Korean and English interviews. Any language can be used.

faq.question: Is my interview data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: Interview data is saved locally as interview-data.md. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: How does this skill handle vague or unclear inputs?
faq.answer: The skill includes strategies for exploring vague inputs through open questions and recent interests.

faq.question: How is this different from regular questioning?
faq.answer: It prioritizes natural conversation flow over rigid surveys, adapting to learner responses dynamically.
